application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: To carry out tree surgery including a crown reduction by 3m and removal of lower overhanging branches to One Oak T36 on TPO 157
decision_conditions: The Oak tree is situated within the front garden of 153 Long Lane, Uxbridge. Long Lane one of the main routes North/South through the borough and as a result has a high volume of traffic. The Oak tree is a prominent feature to the street scene and as a result has a high amenity value, with the potential for a long life.

The applicant has ticked yes to question "Condition of the tree(s) - e.g. it is diseased or you have fears that it might break or fall" however no supporting evidence has been provided. Although further clarification was sort it is still unclear as to the extent of the removal of the low overhanging branches, as a result this is seen as inappropriate however there is a statutory right to lift branches over the highway and footpath (see informative). The upper canopy appears to be in good health and there are no arboricultural reasons to carry out work to this section of the tree, furthermore, pruning will introduce multiple wounds throughout the crown increasing the r

Statutory crown lifting of trees: This does not require formal consent of the Council if the clearance only involves the removal of branches to give a separation between the footway and the tips of the lowest branches by up to 2.3m or the carriageway by up to 5.2m.
The removal of deadwood, dangerous / hanging branches and ivy:  This does not require the formal consent of the Council.
